articles.title: Indonesia rejects China's claims over South China Sea

articles.title: South Africa seek to subdue England at favourite Newlands venue
articles.description: A buoyant South Africa will seek to drive home their advantage at a favourite venue as they host an England side facing a big selection question in the second test of the four-match series starting at Newlands on Friday.
articles.content:
CAPE TOWN (Reuters) - A buoyant South Africa will seek to drive home their advantage at a favourite venue as they host an England side facing a big selection question in the second test of the four-match series starting at Newlands on Friday.

articles.author: Alberto Dabo
articles.title: Former Guinea Bissau PM Embalo wins presidential election
articles.description: Former Guinea-Bissau Prime Minister and ex-army general Umaro Cissoko Embalo won Sunday's presidential election with 54% of the vote, the electoral commission said on Wednesday.
articles.content:
BISSAU (Reuters) - Former Guinea-Bissau Prime Minister and ex-army general Umaro Cissoko Embalo won Sunday’s presidential election with 54% of the vote, the electoral commission said on Wednesday.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Kubica joins Alfa Romeo F1 team as reserve driver
articles.description: Robert Kubica will be Alfa Romeo's Formula One reserve driver for the 2020 season with Polish oil company and personal backer PKN ORLEN joining as co-title sponsor, the Swiss-based team said on Wednesday.
articles.content:
LONDON (Reuters) - Robert Kubica will be Alfa Romeo’s Formula One reserve driver for the 2020 season with Polish oil company and personal backer PKN ORLEN joining as co-title sponsor, the Swiss-based team said on Wednesday.

articles.title: Iraqi paramilitary groups tell supporters to withdraw from U.S. Embassy perimeter
articles.description: Paramilitary groups who have been protesting against U.S. air strikes in Iraq told their supporters to withdraw from the perimeter of the U.S. Embassy in Baghadad on Wednesday.
articles.content:
BAGHDAD (Reuters) - Paramilitary groups who have been protesting against U.S. air strikes in Iraq told their supporters to withdraw from the perimeter of the U.S. Embassy in Baghadad on Wednesday.

articles.title: Floods in Indonesia's capital kill nine, force thousands to evacuate
articles.description: Flash floods inundated swathes of Indonesia's capital and nearby towns on the first day of the New Year after torrential rainfall overnight, killing at least nine people and forcing thousands of people to evacuate, authorities said on Wednesday.

articles.title: New Year brings hope, grief to Somali family devastated by bomb blast
articles.description: As wounded men screaming for their mothers were brought into a Mogadishu hospital after a huge truck bomb on Saturday, doctors fought to save eight month-old Mohammed Hassan, whose mother was already dead.
articles.content:
MOGADISHU (Reuters) - As wounded men screaming for their mothers were brought into a Mogadishu hospital after a huge truck bomb on Saturday, doctors fought to save eight month-old Mohammed Hassan, whose mother was already dead.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Exclusive: Airbus beats goal with 863 deliveries in 2019, up 8% - sources
articles.description: Europe's Airbus handed over a record number of aircraft in December to exceed its 2019 delivery target while seizing the industry's crown as no.1 planemaker from troubled U.S. rival Boeing , airport and tracking sources said on Wednesday.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Sixteen inmates killed in fight in Mexican prison
articles.description: Sixteen inmates were killed and five more were wounded in a fight that broke out in a prison in the northern Mexican state of Zacatecas, the state government said in a statement Tuesday evening.
articles.content:
MEXICO CITY (Reuters) - Sixteen inmates were killed and five more were wounded in a fight that broke out in a prison in the northern Mexican state of Zacatecas, the state government said in a statement Tuesday evening.

articles.title: In New Year message, pope decries violence against women
articles.description: Pope Francis, in his first message of the new year, denounced on Wednesday the use and abuse of women in modern society, and called for an end to the exploitation of the female body.

VATICAN CITY (Reuters) - Pope Francis, in his first message of the new year, denounced on Wednesday the use and abuse of women in modern society, and called for an end to the exploitation of the female body.

articles.title: Surveillance in a leafy enclave, Ghosn's Tokyo life was under strict monitoring
